description: From French critérium (“competition”), from Latin critērium, from Ancient Greek κριτήριον (kritḗrion).

entries.meaning: (cycling) A mass-start road-cycle race consisting of several laps around a closed circuit, the length of each lap or circuit ranging from about 1 km to 2 km (1/2 mile to just over 1 mile).

examples: There is no criterium of truth.
